body.p: Everybody laugh and have big joke about Indian reporter this spring when tell folks all about what weather going to be when I tell them no more cold weather and then have bad winter, but nobody laugh very much when tell in Indian News last week that moon sign tell going to have rain about 25th May when moon change and everybody tell Frisk Cloud Saturday you’re all right Frisk and buy me drink and say think I am pretty smart fellow. People at tavern at depot tell about hear something that sound like drum Friday night and one fellow tell maybe Soderstrom go out on high hill and beat tom-tom and sing song and try to get suit that Joe Christman want to give Indian reporter to make it rain and can’t because I sold tom-tom to Soderstrom. Fellows at Cash Store say going to ask Soderstrom about it if he beat tom-tom and sing song to make big rain and maybe have Winnebagoes make him chief at pow-wow at lake and name him “Chief Rain-In-The-Face”. Indian tribes all good friends and like to have visit with Indians other tribes. Tuesday Indian reporter was in Tomah and got acquainted with Chippewa Indian soldier camped in Tomah. Private Nelson H. Hamlin, Company G. 2nd Infantry, stationed at Fort Wayne, Detroit, Michigan. He is fine fellow and had good talk with Indian reporter and tell me that Indians in every army camp he has been in and white men think they are good soldiers. All Indian soldiers ready to fight for country same as white man and Indian reporter tell Chippewa soldier that Indians should be soldiers and fight for country because this more their country than white man’s because country was their’s first and white man come over here from Europe and take land away from them. Indian reporter get letter every week about people that like Indian News and this week got letter from La Crosse and tell about Indian News beat thing in paper and tell about three people that want to subscribe for Tomah Journal to read about what Indian reporter say. Man that write letter tell about neighbor take paper and he go to his house and get paper every week to read Indian News. Two three fellow want to know from Indian reporter in Tomah Saturday how are blueberries going to be this year. I tell them I don’t know because haven’t been looking for blueberries but went out in my woods Sunday and look around and Monday go to another place and don’t find much blueberries and think they are all shot by big frost and lost dry weather and won’t be many blueberries this year. Found lots of places that look like going to be lots of blackberries and they good too when don’t have blueberries. Indian friends come down here from Black River Falls to fish and when comeback tell about all good fishing places posted and have signs that say you can’t fish here ad trespass and mean same thing. All good fishing place shut up by government or white man own land and just fish himself on land and lot of good cricks spoil for fishing because rich white fellows build dams and don’t have right kind of way for fish to go up crick and get trapped and have to stay in pond or can’t go up stream to like what you call spawn. Indian reporter think good thing to have government man go to rich man’s dam and see if have place that fish can go up crick without have to be leap frog and break neck. .
